titleInfo.title: Burlesque circus parade participants in Baton Rouge.

mods.note: 'The Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks, one of many service organizations active in Baton Rouge during the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, sponsored communitywide entertainments throughout the year. This group of Elks may have been part of a burlesque circus that included a parade, about 1905' â€“ Mark E. Martin, in Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge: photographs 1863-1910, (Baton Rouge, LSU Press, 2008), p. 54.

titleInfo.title: Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge' Photograph Collection/
